title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Newton police are investigating a pig leg or flank found near Flowed Meadow at Auburndale Park.
A red flag and note were placed beside the pig meat in the snow, police stated.
Massachusetts laws prohibit hunting on conservation lands, with investigations including Newton Animal Control and Mass. Environmental Police.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 10-for-28 shooting, contributing defensively with three steals and seven assists in the Celtics' win.
Payton Pritchard scored 30 points off the bench, including key shots, as the Celtics defeated the Lakers 111-89 in Los Angeles.
Nikola Vucevic contributed 9 points and 8 rebounds in 20 minutes; Neemias Queta led center minutes with 25 in the Celtics' rotation.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts, including Boston, Cambridge, and Worcester, are closed on Feb. 23 due to a snowstorm.
The closures were announced as a major snowstorm impacts the region, prompting safety precautions.
Residents are encouraged to check an updating list of school closures for further information.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fall River police are searching for Kyron Simmons, 36, accused of shooting and killing a dog in early February.
Simmons faces charges including home invasion, firearm offenses, and reckless endangerment of a child, according to police.
An arrest warrant has been issued; Simmons is considered armed and dangerous, and police urge public assistance in locating him.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dedham Animal Control reported a bobcat sighting near Deerpath Road and Route 109 last week.
Residents were advised on safe wildlife practices due to increased bobcat activity during mating season.
Recommendations include eliminating outdoor food sources and closely supervising pets to prevent wildlife encounters.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Roman Anthony and Trevor Story are set to bat first and second in the Red Sox 2026 lineup.
Manager Alex Cora confirmed Roman Anthony will lead off Boston's 2026 season after strong performance last year.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa is positioned to start over top prospect Marcelo Mayer despite Mayer's potential and recent play.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts is bracing for a nor’easter with up to 2 feet of snow and high winds impacting power and transportation.
Boston shelters and warming centers will be open all night for the homeless during the storm for safety and warmth.
The MBTA will run reduced storm schedules for trains and buses, while ferry routes are suspended and Doordash pauses service.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman win Olympic gold with Team USA in Milan, ending a 46-year drought.
McAvoy played a pivotal role with 22:45 ice time, thwarting a crucial play against Canada in the gold medal game.
Jeremy Swayman earned a gold, conceding three goals in his Olympic debut during a win over Denmark in group play.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots hold the 31st pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing on offensive linemen and edge rushers.
Oregon TE Kenyon Sadiq is considered for his pass-catching ability by Yahoo Sports despite not being a top priority.
Mock drafts feature prospects like Missouri's Zion Young and Arizona State's Max Iheanachor for potential Patriots selections.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey wins its first Olympic gold medal since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in Milan.
Jack Hughes scored the winning goal in overtime, while goalie Connor Hellebuyck stopped 41 shots.
Matt Boldy opened the scoring for the U.S., and the team maintained a perfect penalty kill throughout the tournament.
